description: Using clay pots to store drinking water, which cools naturally through evaporation.
steps: Store drinking water in a clay pot (Matka).
Place the Matka in a shaded area on a stand.
Cover the mouth of the pot with clean cloth to prevent dust and insects.
Change the water daily to avoid algae and smell.
Reverse the pot every week for maintenance.
risks: Potential for algae growth if water is not changed regularly.
Insects may contaminate water if not covered properly.
